business.headline: Why claiming your PF money seems so difficultIt all starts with tiny mistakes. A spelling error in your name, a mismatch in your date of birth, or an old bank account number can be enough to freeze your claim.

Will India be hit with a 500% tariff? Here's what we knowIndia remains one of the few countries still in talks with the US at a time when the Trump administration is preparing to enforce steep new tariffs on imports from several nations starting August 1.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

entertainment.headline: Actor Silambarasan sheds 10 kg in 10 days for Vetri Maaran's upcoming filmSilambarasan TR, known as STR, has undergone significant weight loss for his role in Vetri Maaran's new film. He reportedly lost around 10 kilograms in 10 days to play a youthful version in the film.

R Madhavan addresses Hindi-Marathi debate, says never faced any problemActor R Madhavan shared his views on the Hindi-Marathi language row. He shared his personal experience and said he never faced any problems because of language.

Stuntman dies during shoot of Pa Ranjith-Arya film, actor Vishal pays tributeStuntman Raju died while performing a car stunt on the sets of an upcoming Kollywood film. The film features actor Arya and is being directed by Pa Ranjith. Actor Vishal paid tribute to Raju on X.

Aamir met Riteish, asked if I was working: Genelia on how she was cast in SitaareActor Genelia Deshmukh discussed how she was cast for 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. She said it was actor Aamir Khan who met her husband Riteish Deshmukh and enquired whether she was working.

Singer Amaal Mallik accuses Anu Malik of ruining father Daboo Malik's careerAmaal Mallik has accused his uncle Anu Malik of professional sabotage that led to his father Daboo Malik's depression, revealing deep family and industry tensions. Despite the rivalry, Amaal seeks to establish his own identity in music while distancing himself from Anu's controversial past.

Diljit Dosanjh stuns in intense Punjab 95 poster as Jaswant Singh KhalraDiljit Dosanjh's latest poster for 'Punjab 95' powerfully captures the intense narrative of slain human rights activist Jaswant Singh Khalra. He shared the poster on social media on Sunday.

Shilpa Shetty hesitant to work in Malayalam films, says won't be able to do justiceActor Shilpa Shetty shared that she has been offered a few movies in Malayalam but never felt sure if she could do justice to her role. She also shared her admiration for actor Mohanlal.

Munawar Faruqui's son hospitalised, wife Mehzabeen shares update in touching postComedian Munawar Faruqui is facing a personal challenge as his son Mikael battles a viral infection. His partner, Mehzabeen Coatwala, shared the update on social media.

Aayush Sharma reflects on back surgeries, says ignored body's signsActor Aayush Sharma recently reflected on his back surgeries. In an interview, he noted that a six-pack body doesn't necessarily mean a fit body. He also stated that his time at the hospital helped him bond with his family.

Superman box office Day 2: James Gunn film soars past F1, Jurassic World in IndiaJames Gunn's 'Superman' starring David Corenswet has made a strong debut at the Indian box office, earning Rs 9.25 crore on its second day and leading over recent Hollywood and Bollywood releases.

Jackie Shroff joins Kartik Aaryan's Tu Meri Main Tera, fans say OG with Gen Z heroActors Kartik Aaryan and Jackie Shroff are all set to team up for the upcoming film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'. The announcement video sparked excitement amongst fans on social media. In the film, Aaryan is paired opposite actor Ananya Panday.

Kota Srinivasa Rao dies: Chiranjeevi, Pawan Kalyan attend funeral, pay tributeProminent Tollywood stars gathered to pay their respects to late Telugu icon Kota Srinivasa Rao on Sunday. He died at 83, leaving behind a rich legacy in Indian cinema with over 750 films across multiple languages.

Amaal Mallik on distancing from family: Mother would compare my journey with ArmaanSinger Amaal Mallik shared that he cut ties with his parents due to constant comparisons with his brother, Armaan Malik. However, he clarified that he shares no issues with the latter and continues to have a strong bond with him.

Actor Vanessa Hudgens announces second pregnancy with husband Cole TuckerVanessa Hudgens and her husband Cole Tucker are thrilled to announce they are expecting their second child, sharing the joyful news on Instagram. The couple, who welcomed their first child last year, are eagerly preparing to embrace the next chapter of parenthood together.

Maalik vs Aankhon box office Day 2: Rajkummar's film shows growth, Vikrant's lagsRajkummar Rao's gangster drama 'Maalik' is making a strong mark at the box office with rising collections and positive word of mouth. In contrast, the romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' has seen a modest start, struggling to connect with audiences.

Anant-Radhika's 1st anniversary: SRK, Salman Khan to Ranveer Singh, celebs send loveBollywood stars Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan, and Ranveer Singh extended their wishes to Anant Ambani and Radhika Merchant on their first wedding anniversary, celebrating the grand occasion with warmth and affection.

Metro In Dino budget is half of reported Rs 85 crore: Sources'Metro... In Dino' was made on a modest Rs 40 crore budget, half of the reported Rs 85 crore. The film is steadily climbing the box office and gaining appreciation for its storytelling and realistic characters.

Chiranjeevi to Jr NTR, celebs mourn Telugu actor Kota Srinivasa Rao's deathVeteran Telugu actor and former MLA Kota Srinivasa Rao died on July 13. Following the news of his death, several prominent figures from the Telugu film industry paid heartfelt tributes.

Kota Srinivasa Rao, Telugu film icon and ex-Andhra MLA dies at 83Rao made his debut in 1978 with the Telugu film Pranam Khareedu and went on to star in over 750 feature films across Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, and other Indian languages.

general news.headline: Wimbledon: Jannik Sinner wins maiden title, denies Carlos Alcaraz three-peatWimbledon 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner won his maiden title at the All England Club after beating Carlos Alcaraz in four sets on Centre Court. Alcaraz was looking to become the fifth man to win the title three times on the trot, but Sinner denied him the three-peat and conquered grass.

Sutra mutra hai: Tejashwi Yadav flushes claims of foreigners in Bihar voter listRJD leader Tejashwi Yadav was reacting to inputs reportedly received by the Election Commission that fake voters from Bangladesh and Nepal were present in poll-bound Bihar.

Plane crashes moments after takeoff at London airport, turns into fireballThe crash led to the cancellation of at least four scheduled flights on Sunday afternoon, according to the airport's website. Authorities have not yet disclosed how many people were on board the aircraft or their condition.

Slow burn to fireworks: 14-wicket Day 4 sets up cracking Lord's Test finaleLord's Test: After three days of slowburn, the third Test exploded on Day 4. India bowled England out for 192 before England fought back with four wickets late on Sunday. The fifth and final day promises to be a cracker.

India looks ambitious, fearless from space, says Shux ahead of homecomingIn a heartfelt ceremony, Shubhanshu Shukla reflected on his journey, the achievements of the mission, and the collaborative spirit that defined his time in orbit.

Saina Nehwal announces separation with Parupalli KashyapBadminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have decided to separate after nearly 7 years of marriage. Saina announced her decision in an Instagram post on Sunday, July 13.

Tripura girl, missing in Delhi for 6 days, found dead in YamunaSneha was a student of Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College, Delhi University, and had been living in Delhi away from her family for some time.

Ahead of Jaishankar's visit, China says Dalai Lama succession thorn in India tiesAhead of celebrations this month for his 90th birthday that were attended by senior Indian ministers, the head of Tibetan Buddhists riled China again by saying it had no role in his succession.

Video: Plane crashes at London airport, plumes of black smoke billows into airA small aircraft crashed at London Southend Airport on England's southeast coast on Sunday afternoon, authorities said. It was a Beech B200 Super King Air passenger plane, which was headed to the Netherlands.

Can India chase 193 at Lord's? Here's what history suggestsEngland vs India: India bowled England out for 192 on Day 4 of the third Test at Lord's. Washington Sundar's impressive four-wicket haul was key in restricting England on a challenging pitch.

Lawyer shot dead in Patna as 4 killed in 24 hours amid Bihar shooting spreeJitendra Kumar Mahto, a lawyer by profession, was returning after having tea when he was shot by unidentified men. He visited the spot every day, the victim's family confirmed.

IDF blames 'technical error' for Gaza strike that killed children collecting waterLocal residents reported that many families walk about 2 kilometres just to collect water. They said about 20 children and 14 adults were at the site when the missile hit.

Saare jahan se accha: Shux's message to India ahead of undockingLaunched on June 26, 2025, from NASA's Kennedy Space Center, the Ax-4 mission has seen the crew complete over 250 orbits of Earth, travelling over six million miles.

Glass panels carried by e-rickshaw shattered on Delhi's Kanwar Yatra route: CopsA junior engineer of the Public Works Department alleged that shards of glass were scattered on the road used by Kanwariyas, many of whom walk barefoot on their way to Haridwar in Uttarakhand for pilgrimage.

Two killed and several injured in Kentucky church shooting, suspect also deadPolice said the Lexington Police Department (LPD) and KSP officers were able to "secure the suspect" at the church. The individual has since been confirmed dead. The suspect's identity has not yet been released, and officials are now working to understand what led to the incident.

Gurugram rain kills auto driver as wife calls him all night, gets no replyThe victim's wife said she continued calling him through the night and into Thursday morning, and called around 200 times, the Times of India reported, but got no response. The family eventually informed the police.
Fujifilm X-M5 review: The camera that made me feel something againThe Fujifilm X-M5 rekindles the charm of digital photography with solid design and impressive video chops.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

2025 Bajaj Pulsar NS400Z review, first ride: Most fun motorcycle under Rs 2 lakh?We first rode Bajaj's value-for-money performance streetfighter in May 2024, and now there's an update. Is the 2025 NS400Z still maximum bang for your buck?

Mumbai man with upset stomach falls to death from 18th floor while defecatingA 52-year-old man with an upset stomach fell to his death from the 18th floor of a building on Sunday while defecating from the edge of a shaft near a lift.

Bengaluru couple stunned as 'eye doctor' links myopia to marriage, childrenA Bengaluru-based couple was stunned after an 'eye doctor' linked myopia to marriage and advised them to consult before conceiving. His remarks sparked outrage online.

How dehatism is ruining tourismDehatism is killing the experience of tourists in India and abroad. From dancing shirtless in Switzerland for a reel and dragging Vietnamese women for selfies to stripping locals of privacy in Goa's Fontainhas and drinking in public at the Rohtang Pass, dehatism is on full display. The dehatis aren't the Indians from the mofussil, but those from urban centres with big money but little sense.

Brook slammed after rash dismissal at Lord's: Not Bazball, just arroganceHarry Brook received massive criticism after his rash shot resulted in his dismissal to give India the advantage, just as England looked to mount a counter-attack.

Magical journey onboard Space Station: Shux's homecoming messageGroup Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, the Axiom-4 Mission pilot, is preparing to return to Earth after spending nearly two-and-a-half weeks onboard the International Space Station (ISS).

Actor Silambarasan sheds 10 kg in 10 days for Vetri Maaran's upcoming filmSilambarasan TR, known as STR, has undergone significant weight loss for his role in Vetri Maaran's new film. He reportedly lost around 10 kilograms in 10 days to play a youthful version in the film.

R Madhavan addresses Hindi-Marathi debate, says never faced any problemActor R Madhavan shared his views on the Hindi-Marathi language row. He shared his personal experience and said he never faced any problems because of language.

sports.headline: Ice-cold Palmer destroys PSG as Chelsea win inaugural Club World CupChelsea hammered 3 goals past Champions League winners PSG to win the inaugural FIFA Club World Cup. Cole Palmer scored a brace and provided an assist as the Premier League club ripped apart PSG.

Calm and composed after Wimbledon high, Sinner jokes about brother's F1 crazeWimbledon 2025: Jannik Sinner playfully poked fun at his brother after winning his maiden title at the All England Club. A devoted Formula 1 fan, Sinner's brother had skipped the Italian Open final earlier this year but made sure to be in the stands on Sunday to cheer him on at Wimbledon.

Saina Nehwal announces separation with Parupalli KashyapBadminton stars Saina Nehwal and Parupalli Kashyap have decided to separate after nearly 7 years of marriage. Saina announced her decision in an Instagram post on Sunday, July 13.

Alcaraz was looking to become the fifth man to win the title three times on the trot, but Sinner denied him the three-peat and conquered grass.

FIFA Club World Cup Final Highlights: Chelsea thrash PSG 3-0 in electric finaleFIFA Club World Cup 2025 Final Highlights: Chelsea beat PSG in the final of the Club World Cup. Cole Palmer and Joao Pedro combined to score three goals and hand a damning defeat to Luis Enrique's team.

Slow burn to fireworks: 14-wicket Day 4 sets up cracking Lord's Test finaleLord's Test: After three days of slowburn, the third Test exploded on Day 4. India bowled England out for 192 before England fought back with four wickets late on Sunday. The fifth and final day promises to be a cracker.

Paul Reiffel is the new Steve Bucknor: Fans slam umpiring at Lord'sUmpire Paul Reiffel faced heavy criticism for poor decisions against India at Lord's Test. The controversial calls sparked frustration amongst players and fans.

Gambhir vindicated as Sundar bowls generational spell at Lord'sWashington Sundar's brilliant spin bowling helped India bowl out England in the Lord's Test. Gambhir's faith in Sundar proved pivotal in restricting England's second innings total.

IOA constitutes panel to investigate prolonged delay in BFI electionsThe Indian Olympic Association has set up a committee to investigate delays in BFI elections. The probe aims to ensure fair polls and address governance concerns amid factional disputes.

IOA constitutes panel to investigate prolonged delay in BFI electionsThe Indian Olympic Association has set up a committee to investigate delays in BFI elections. The probe aims to ensure fair polls and address governance concerns amid factional disputes.

Rafael Nadal Academy star joins historic club with maiden Wimbledon titleWimbledon 2025: Bulgaria's Ivan Ivanov won the boys singles title after beating Ronit Karki of the United States 6-2, 6-3 on Sunday, July 13. The 16-year-old trains at the Rafael Nadal Academy in Mallorca.

Avinash Sable out for 2 weeks after nasty fall in Monaco Diamond LeagueAvinash Sable suffered a minor knee injury after a fall at the Monaco Diamond League. Despite the setback, he is likely to return in maximum two weeks.

Mohammed Siraj upset, Sunil Gavaskar blasts DRS after Joe Root survives LBW appeal England vs India: Sunil Gavaskar criticised the ball-tracking technology after Joe Root was saved by an umpire's call at Lord's. Mohammed Siraj was left frustrated after a couple of close calls went against him on Sunday.

Pakistan Cricket Board under fire for illegal activities, financial irregularitiesThe Auditor General of Pakistan has uncovered major financial irregularities in the Pakistan Cricket Board, involving millions of rupees. The audit flagged unauthorized appointments, dubious contract awards, and a questionable payment of ₹63.39 million to police for meals during international match security.

Chicken curry, daal, paneer korma: Desi menu at Lord's on Day 4Lord's cricket ground served a special desi menu on Day 4 of the India vs England Test match. The unique culinary offering enhanced the fan experience and showcased a blend of Indian and continental dishes.

Final LIVE: Jannik Sinner conquers grass, wins maiden Wimbledon crownWimbledon 2025 men's singles final Live Updates: Jannik Sinner wins his maiden Wimbledon crown. The World No. 1 has overcome the hurt of French Open final to deny Carlos Alcaraz a three-peat. He bounces back from a set down to win 4-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4.

Final LIVE: Jannik Sinner conquers grass, wins maiden Wimbledon crownWimbledon 2025 men's singles final Live Updates: Jannik Sinner wins his maiden Wimbledon crown. The World No. 1 has overcome the hurt of French Open final to deny Carlos Alcaraz a three-peat. He bounces back from a set down to win 4-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4.

Brook slammed after rash dismissal at Lord's: Not Bazball, just arroganceHarry Brook received massive criticism after his rash shot resulted in his dismissal to give India the advantage, just as England looked to mount a counter-attack.

Joe Root joins Sachin Tendulkar in elite club with 8000 Test runs at No.4ENG vs IND: Former England captain Joe Root became only the fourth batter after Sachin Tendulkar, Mahela Jayawardene, and Jacques Kallis to complete 8000 Test runs while batting at No.4.

Watch: Siraj gives fiery send-off to Ben Duckett, forces umpires to interveneIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj gave a fiery send-off to England opener Ben Duckett after dismissing him on Day 4 of the third Test against England at Lord's.

Gyokeres threatened with fines by Sporting chief after pre-season no-showViktor Gyokeres is expected to face heavy penalties after failing to show up to training for Sporting CP. Amidst links to a move away from the Portuguese club, the move has yet to materialise.

Rahane on a possible Test comeback: Tried having conversations with selectorsAjinkya Rahane, who has fallen out of favour with the Indian Test team, revealed that he has tried to have conversations with the selectors for a possible return. After hearing no response, he is now focused on playing his best cricket in the domestic format, hoping he gets a chance.

PSG vs Chelsea, Club World Cup Final Livestreaming: Battle of rise vs gloryChelsea and PSG are set for a high-stakes showdown at MetLife Stadium as the FIFA Club World Cup reaches its grand finale—one chasing history, the other seeking a fresh start under new leadership.

Day 4 Highlights: England leave India reeling at stumps in 193 chaseIndia vs England, 3rd Test Day 4 Highlights: India have been left in trouble at stumps on Day 4 as they're 58/4 chasing 193 in the fourth innings. Shubman Gill's dismissal just before stumps came as a major blow for the visitors as they now rely on KL Rahul to take them home and go 2-1 up in the series.

Gill-Crawley's delay drama at Lord's: Vaughan says no team can complainMichael Vaughan reckons that both India and England cannot complain about each other's time-wasting antics. He offered a fairly neutral take on the whole drama that ensued in the final over of Day 3.

KL Rahul immortalised at the Lord's museum with his special signed jerseyKL Rahul has been immortalised at the Home of Cricket with his signed jersey being given to the Lord's museum. He scored a historic century to cement his legacy at the iconic venue.

Nadal's special message to Anisimova after Wimbledon final loss: Be proudAfter her historic Wimbledon final loss, Amanda Anisimova received a heartfelt message from Rafael Nadal, who urged her to be proud of reaching a Grand Slam final — a rare and remarkable feat in itself.

Shamar Joseph leads West Indies' fight as Australia fold under lightsThe West Indies put up a spirited performance in the first pink-ball Test in Jamaica as they bundled out Australia in the final session of Day 1. Mitchell Starc took the early wicket before the end of the day's play.

Iga Swiatek blasts Polish media after Wimbledon triumph: Let me do my jobIga Swiatek, hit back at the Polish media for their criticisms during her worst period in her career after her historic win at the Wimbledon 2025 final with a flawless performance where she did not concede a single game point.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
